Aaaaba: A genus of beetles from the Buprestidae family.
apocope: The loss of one or more sounds from the end of a word, and especially the loss of an unstressed vowel.
calque: A loan translation; a word or phrase borrowed from another language by literal, word-for-word, or root-for-root translation.
kenning: conventional metaphoric name for something, used especially in Old Norse poetry
oneirology: The study of dreams and their interpretation
micromania: A delusional state in which the patient believes himself diminutive in size and mentally inferior.
steganography: the practice of concealing messages or information within other nonsecret text or data.
